title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 61-1.35 - Personnel; health monitoring programs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 61-1.35 - Personnel; health monitoring programs

State Regulations

The institution and the PI shall be responsible for determining, in connection with each recombinant DNA activity, medical surveillance of all personnel with duties in recombinant DNA activity facilities before, during, and after their involvement in the activity, including, as appropriate, a serum collection program, periodic examinations, immunizations, reporting and investigating accidents and illnesses and medical evaluation. Note: See NIH Laboratory Safety Monograph for further details. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10

61-1.35

See NIH Laboratory Safety Monograph for further
details. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
